meanings.definition: Ready or likely to attack or confront.
meanings.sent1: The aggressive dog barked loudly at the stranger.
meanings.sent2: The coach praised the team for their aggressive play on the field.
meanings.sent3: The aggressive squirrel chased away all the other animals from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her aggressive sales tactics helped her close the deal quickly.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive storm clouds loomed ominously in the sky.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or resulting from aggression.
meanings.sent1: The aggressive behavior of the bullies was unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive response from the enemy troops escalated the conflict.
meanings.sent3: The aggressive growth of the plant took over the entire garden.
meanings.sent4: His aggressive driving style often led to road rage incidents.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive tone of the email made her feel uneasy.

meanings.definition: Assertive, bold, or energetic in pursuit of a goal.
meanings.sent1: She took an aggressive approach to solving the problem.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive student always volunteered to lead group projects.
meanings.sent3: The aggressive dancer captivated the audience with her moves.
meanings.sent4: His aggressive work ethic impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive runner sprinted towards the finish line with determination.
